biogHist.abstract: There is a collection of material donated by Donna Jaggs held at the National Orphanage Museum and managed by the Care Leavers of Australia Network [CLAN]. It includes publications, scrapbooks and press clippings relating to the history of child welfare in Victoria.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Care Leavers of Australia Network (CLAN) - Contact Details

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Material donated by Donna Jaggs', in Find & Connect - Victoria,
A guide to charity and to the philanthropic work of Victoria

archref.unittitle: A guide to charity and to the philanthropic work of Victoria
archref.abstract: This is a digital copy of the guide published by the Charity Organisation Society of Melbourne in 1912.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Neglected Children's Department, Victoria 1.07.04', bound volume of press clippings with index at front

archref.unittitle: 'Neglected Children's Department, Victoria 1.07.04', bound volume of press clippings with index at front
archref.abstract: Collection of newsclippings, apparently compiled by employees of the Neglected Children's Department. The articles are about child welfare issues, primarily in Victoria. This album would have been a resource for the department's staff.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Catherine Jaggs thesis, 'The Melbourne child-saving movement 1888-1910'

archref.unittitle: Catherine Jaggs thesis, 'The Melbourne child-saving movement 1888-1910'
archref.abstract: This Honours Thesis explores the history of the child-saving movement in Melbourne through a study of Kildonan, the Victorian Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children and St Joseph's Home for Destitute Children.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Stories from a twentieth century life [Chapter 8 Pirra Children's Home]

archref.unittitle: Stories from a twentieth century life [Chapter 8 Pirra Children's Home]
archref.abstract: A chapter from a draft version of Nancy McDonald's autobiography in which she recounts her work as Superintendent of Pirra Children's Home, from 1968 to 1979.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Spence, 'State children in Australia: a history of boarding out and its developments', 1907

archref.unittitle: Spence, 'State children in Australia: a history of boarding out and its developments', 1907
archref.abstract: A book about boarding out in Australia, written by Catherine Helen Spence. Spence had a long involvement with boarding out in South Australia and was a prominent figure in the field.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Anglican Mission to the Streets and Lanes. Outline History

archref.unittitle: Anglican Mission to the Streets and Lanes. Outline History
archref.abstract: This outline history of the Anglican Mission to the Streets and Lanes is presented in the form of a timeline.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The battered baby and the limits of the law

archref.unittitle: The battered baby and the limits of the law
archref.abstract: Text of the Seventh Wilfred Fullagar Memorial Lecture, delivered by JD McLean. Published in the Monash University Law Review, Vol. 5, no. 1, 1978.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Getting the Acts together: an analysis of attempts to reform child protective legislation in Victoria 1978-83

archref.unittitle: Getting the Acts together: an analysis of attempts to reform child protective legislation in Victoria 1978-83
archref.abstract: A report by S. Charlesworth about the difficulties of achieving reform of child welfare legislation in Victoria, particularly the Community Welfare Services Act 1970 and the Children's Court Act 1973, between 1978 and 1983.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Two different worlds: cultural and political conflict in a 19th century boys reformatory

archref.unittitle: Two different worlds: cultural and political conflict in a 19th century boys reformatory
archref.abstract: This is a copy of an essay by David Maunders, examining the management of the Olinda Farm Reformatory in the late nineteenth century. It gives some information about life in the reformatory during the 1890s through a study of the superintendent's diary.

Collection of newsclippings, believed to have been compiled by an employee of the Neglected Children's Department. The articles are about child welfare issues, primarily in Victoria but also in other states and nations. This album would have been a resource for the department's staff, providing information about how their own work was being portrayed in the media and also about how other child welfare departments were approaching their work.
